item.title: Julia add a quote by Rollo May
item.description: "It is an ironic habit of human beings to run faster when they have lost their way." -- Rollo May

item.title: Julia add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "A good bookshop is just a genteel Black Hole that knows how to read." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Julia add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "Never run from anything immortal. It attracts their attention. " -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Julia add a quote by Don Borchert
item.description: "The patron gets comfortable in bed and opens up the book -- it opens tentatively -- and the patron bends the open book backward until there is a satisfying crack and the book is a little more supple, a little easier to read. The book spine has just been broken, and a broken spine means a more submissive book." -- Don Borchert

item.title: Julia add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Julia add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "A book, too, can be a star, a living fire to lighten the darkness, leading out into the expanding universe." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Julia add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Julia add a quote by James Russell Lowell
item.description: "Books are the bees which carry the quickening pollen from one to another mind." -- James Russell Lowell

item.title: Julia add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "A classic is a book that has never finished saying what it has to say." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Julia add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Julia add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "There's no use going to school unless your final destination is the library." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Julia add a quote by Herman Hesse
item.description: "Some of us think holding on makes us strong but sometimes it is letting go" -- Herman Hesse

item.title: Julia add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "Within Siddhartha there slowly grew and ripened the knowledge of what wisdom really was and the goal of his long seeking. It was nothing but a preparation of the soul, a capacity, a secret art of thinking, feeling and breathing thoughts of unity at every moment of life." -- Hermann Hesse
